text.0: Fack checking groups @DubawaNG, @AfricaCheck, @AFPFactCheck, @PesaCheck @Meedan - part of @WHO's Africa Infodemic Response Alliance - launch initiative to tackle the spread of COVID-19 misinformation on the continent: https://t.co/ZFQlB4xUTG @r2kcampaign @MediaMattersZA @ZimFact
text.1: Ogun State Police PRO, DSP Abimbola Oyeyemi, said police is the least corrupt government agency in Nigeria. This is false. A study conducted by the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) shows police is the most corrupt agency in Nigeria. https://t.co/rnhVbMZGW3 #DubawaChecks
text.2:
“We have sophisticated weapons to attack the US, UK, EU if they dare to interfere in our elections." 

This viral quote has been attributed to Lai Mohammed since 2019 but there is no public or confirmed record him of saying it. Read here: https://t.co/JxV79AE6BI #DubawaChecks
text.3: Lai Mohammed's recent claim that the reason Nigeria is still battling insecurity and terrorism is because global partners  blocked Nigeria’s weapon purchase is misleading. Read the facts here: https://t.co/v5mqZBOtmp #DubawaChecks
text.4:
Be wary of results being announced on social media. 
#DubawaChecks #GhanaDecides2020 #GhanaElections #ghanaelections2020 #Ghana2020Elections @Citi973 https://t.co/FoMOguafOM
text.5:
Claim: Social media users share viral video claiming NPP’s Ashanti Regional Chairman has been arrested by police for possession of thumb-printed ballot papers.
Find full check here: https://t.co/HbDbxSNuOS
#DubawaChecks #GhanaDecides2020 #GhanaElections #ghanaelections2020 https://t.co/s0oace3Ja4
text.6: A statement by the Electoral Commission declares the alleged stuffing of ballots in Asawase constituency as misleading. @ECGhanaOfficial #DubawaChecks #GhanaDecides2020 #GhanaElections #ghanaelections2020 #Ghana2020elections https://t.co/UmVwAyedfz
text.7: How to deal with Fishy information. #DubawaChecks #GhanaDecides2020 #GhanaElections #ghanaelections2020 #Ghana2020elections https://t.co/xPJpJlWoJd
text.8: Yahaya Bello, Governor of Kogi State, claimed that the All Progressive Congress (APC) is securing Nigeria. However, data showing number of deaths, kidnappings, insecurity and banditry violence shows that his claim is false. Read here: https://t.co/n8xOK2MhBE #DubawaChecks
text.9: Dubawa and other agencies have partnered with the World Health Organisation (WHO) to tackle misinformation about the #Covid19 pandemic with the Africa Infodemic Response Alliance (AIRA) initiative. Click the link to read more: https://t.co/uRSFye2Qy6 #DubawaChecks
